BiblioData.Abstract: A magnetoresistance effect device including a multilayer structure having a pair of ferromagnetic layers and a barrier layer positioned between them, wherein at least one ferromagnetic layer has at least the part contacting the barrier layer made amorphous and the barrier layer is an MgO layer having a single crystal structure.

Claims.P: 1. A magnetoresistance effect device characterized by having a multilayer comprising:
a first amorphous ferromagnetic layer formed by magnetron DC sputtering;
a second amorphous ferromagnetic layer formed by magnetron DC sputtering; and
a crystalline magnesium oxide layer disposed between the first and the second ferromagnetic layers, which is formed by magnetron RF sputtering;
2. A magnetoresistance effect device as set forth in claim 1, characterized in that each of the first and the second ferromagnetic layers includes CoFeB.
3. A magnetoresistance effect device characterized by having a multilayer comprising:
an anti-ferromagnetic layer formed by sputtering;
a first amorphous ferromagnetic layer formed by magnetron DC sputtering;
a second amorphous ferromagnetic layer formed by magnetron DC sputtering; and
a crystalline magnesium oxide layer disposed between the first and the second ferromagnetic layers, which is formed by magnetron RF sputtering;
wherein the multilayer is annealed to magnetize the anti-ferromagnetic layer.
4. A magnetoresistance effect device as set forth in claim 3, characterized in that each of the first and the second ferromagnetic layers includes CoFeB.
